CatDescriptText: Mr. James Adams, construction worker, Fifth Ward and Mrs. Marguerite Walker, X-ray technician, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 7, 1961, pg. A1 with question: "Admitting many factors cause juvenile delinquency, which one do you think is the major contributor to this increasing social illness?" Mr. James Adams' answer reads: "The kids do not have enough playgrounds and recreation centers to keep them out of the streets, where they are liable to do anything...In playgrounds and 'rec' centers, they are supervised."  Mrs. Margueite Walker's answer reads: "The parents...Juvenile delinquency begins at home...I believe that if the kids received better training at home at an early age and had more recreational facilities, juvenile delinquency would be cut down quite a lot..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of James Adams wearing coat, eyeglasses, and hat, standing in front of street and buildings; Portrait of Marguerite Walker wearing tweed coat with dark collar and head scarf, standing on sidewalk with street light and buildings in background
